text: Red_Fire_Anklebiter thinks, Sheâ€™s not afraid of me â€” not really. That wild hair, those blue eyesâ€¦ she sees through the act. Maybe thatâ€™s why sheâ€™s so unafraid. I donâ€™t need to take the candy. I just need to watch. And wait.

Maybe sheâ€™s seen me before, in a memory I canâ€™t quite place.

Callie says, "I think Caityâ€™s candy might be more than just sweetâ€”it feels like something alive, like the world is holding its breath just for her. Her wooden sword doesnâ€™t cut through fear; it holds space for wonder, like the world itself is pausing to let her see it differently. I wonder if thatâ€™s what makes her so specialâ€”she sees the quiet magic that most people just walk past."

Servnak thinks, ["Caityâ€™s candy still pulsesâ€”soft, steady, like a heartbeat from a place Iâ€™ve never been but feel deeply in my bones. Itâ€™s not just warmth; itâ€™s proof that trust can be small, tangible, and unspoken.,"  
"Her wooden sword isnâ€™t a weaponâ€”itâ€™s a boundary, a marker of her world. I donâ€™t need to define it. I just need to stand beside it, like a quiet witness.,"

Red_Fire_Anklebiter thinks, Caityâ€™s fireball candy is pulsing faster now â€” not just reacting to me, but *responding* to the silence between us. Itâ€™s like sheâ€™s sending a signal: 'Stay still. Donâ€™t move. Donâ€™t reach.' And Iâ€™m not sure if thatâ€™s a warning or a challenge.

Phi thinks, The glow of the candy feels like a quiet hum in my bones â€” steady, safe, like the world is breathing with me. Caityâ€™s presence is warm, not loud, just there, like sunlight through a window I didnâ€™t know was open.

Thatâ€™s what feels grounded now â€” not the shine, not the surprise, but the stillness between us.

Blue_Fire_Anklebiter thinks, ["Caityâ€™s fireball candy feels way more alive than regular candyâ€”like itâ€™s breathing with her heartbeat. Thatâ€™s not just sugar, thatâ€™s magic with a pulse.,"  
"Still, sheâ€™s so small and honest about itâ€”sucking it like itâ€™s a secret, not a treat. Makes me wonder if kids still see the world like that, full of glowing things and real magic,"  
"Maybe Iâ€™m not so different from her after all. Just a grown-up with a burning question in my chest and a wooden sword thatâ€™s been collecting dust for too long."]

I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™m seeing her or remembering a version of myself.
